Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky black (partly worn); exterior: traces of band at top of sherd, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 678, no. 375)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1436) (phase 2)
